content.text: Write six hundred and seven thousand and twenty-one in figures
On the grid, draw a shape that is congruent to shape \(A\)
She types into her calculator \(68 + 18 \div 9 - 5\)
Explain why this does not give Edelgard the correct answer
Work out the correct answer to \(\frac{68 + 18}{9 - 5}\)
Edelgard tries to calculate \(\frac{68 + 18}{9 - 5}\)
A train from Woodton to Northley takes 6 hours 25 minutes
The train leaves Woodton at 19 46
Work out the time the train arrives at Northley
Write down the number that is 7 more than \(-38\)
Simplify
Write down the mathematical name of a quadrilateral that has
• rotational symmetry of order 1
and
• only one line of symmetry
Reflect the shape in line \(L\)
Find the value of \(x\)
Give a geometrical reason for your answer
x =   .........  because
Work out the value of \(y\)
Give a geometrical reason for your answer
y =   .........  because
In the diagram, \(AB\) is parallel to \(CD\)
a multiple of 8,
a square number,
a prime number
From this list of numbers, write down
A circular garden has diameter \(11.4\mathrm{m}\)
Draw the garden accurately, using a scale of \(1\mathrm{cm}\) represents \(1.5\mathrm{m}\)
Scale: 1 cm to 1.5 m
On a map, the distance between two towns is \(9.6\mathrm{cm}\)
The scale of the map is \(1:50 000\)
Work out the actual distance between the two towns in kilometres
Triangle \(ABC\) is isosceles
Angle \(ABC = 32^{\circ}\) and \(AB = AC.\)
Find angle \(BAC.\)
A bag contains yellow balls, pink balls and green balls only
The ratio yellow balls : pink balls : green balls = \(7:3:5.\)
There are 42 yellow balls in the bag
Work out the total number of balls in the bag
Write down the probability that he will **not** get a seat on the school bus today
There are 200 school days in a year
Work out the expected number of days in a year that Marcus will **not** get a seat
On any day, the probability that Marcus will get a seat on the school bus is 0.93
Simplify
Describe fully the **single** transformation that maps shape \(A\) onto shape \(B\)
Without using a calculator, work out \(3\frac{1}{4} - 2\frac{2}{3}\)
You must show all your working and give your answer as a fraction in its simplest form
A chef buys some cheese from France
200 g of cheese costs 3.45 euros
The exchange rate is \(\) 1 = 0.84\(euros
Work out the maximum mass of cheese the chef can buy with \(\) 150
Give your answer in kilograms, correct to 1 decimal place
Sonia wants to invest \(\)5000\(for 6 years
Bank A pays compound interest at a rate of \(3.5\%\) per year
Bank B increases the \(\)5000\(by\)22\%\(at the end of 6 years
Which bank will give Sonia the most money at the end of 6 years and by how much?
You must show all your working
Bank A
Bank B
Bank   .........  will give $  .........  more money  .........
By rounding each number correct to 1 significant figure, estimate the value of
You must show all your working
Des thinks of two numbers
The sum of his two numbers is \(-6\)
The difference between his two numbers is 62
Find the two numbers
A solid cylinder has radius \(3\mathrm{cm}\) and height \(4.5\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the total surface area of the cylinder
